title: The Departure
content:
I left long ago
I didn't go with the flow
The voice came from within
Kept pleading, kept insisting therein
Resolute, I severed ties
Cutting ✂ loose that past with a final goodbye
The road behind me faded to dust
And when I crossed
I burned the bridges behind me
So that if I ever thought of going back
There would be no way

title: Home
content:
“I love you...”
Came the whisper —
Soft and tender in my ear.
It brought a wave — calm and soothing —
A hush that settled my fear.

For a moment —
Or should I say... a few long moments —
The world slowed to stillness.
Time held its breath.
The clock had hit pause.

I indulged in the heavenly warmth.
My heart exhaled —
It felt at home.
And all the cold I’d carried
Melted into the air.

The shivers faded.
Peace wrapped around me
Like a quiet cloud.

Finally...
Here I was —
Home.

title: My Cry
content:
They say the end of the world is nigh
And I want to go to heaven when I die
I lift my eyes to look up on high
And bid the world a quick bye
I search to behold his compassionate eye
But His face turns away with a sigh
Because the life I lived was a lie

title: For a Friend..
content:
From afar, I could hear the bells —
Sounded like echoes from deep wells.
And whether by fate or coincidence,
Beyond whatever I call preference,
We fell in — as friends.

A priceless gift you’ve been to me,
With a heart so warm, a soul so free.
Of all the lights I’ve found incandescent,
You’ve become the most radiant —
So full of life and grace.

No words could ever truly say
My gratitude in the perfect way.
Of joy that’s always found its place,
I’d carve it into stone — just in case —
To show how beautiful life has been with you.

And so, on this special Friday,
I wish you joy in every way.
May your days be full of furahi,
More than just 60-bob bread and chai!
May you thrive in all you do —
And may what’s meant for you
Always find its way.

title: The Whisper
content:
“I love you,” it said —
time froze, my chest filled with warmth.
Peace wrapped around me.
The voice penetrating my ear —
all the cold inside melted.
At last... I was home.

title: The Smile They Asked For
content:
They told me to keep smiling
To make it genuine and shining
They said it lit up the room
Chased away every gloom
Like heat melting ice,
Or butter on warm bread — so nice.

But as days slipped by,
That smile began to die.
My face still held the trace,
But tension had taken its place.

Crushed by what I couldn’t name,
But somehow, I felt the blame.
Not because I couldn't see,
Not blindness — just reality.
From where I sat,
Just like that...
There seemed
No reason to.

title: My Desire
content:
I want someone beside me,
Not just close in distance, 
But close in spirit-
Someone whose presence settles me,
Whose voice softens the noise in my mind.

I want your arms around me, love
Holding me like I'm something gentle,
Something worth slowing down for.
I want your hands to learn my language
Without me having to speak.

I want to hear you say you love me-
Not out of routine,
But because you feel it rising in you
The same way it rises in me.
I want you to want me
With the same quiet intensity
That I've carried for you
Long before you ever arrived.

Because right now,
You only exist in my mind-
A warm thought,
A future promise,
A whisper of the life I know we'll share.

Sometimes I wonder,
How long until our timelines meet?
How long until I look up
And suddenly you are real!
Standing there with the softness
I've prayed for in secret.

Still, I won't rush.
This deep longing doesn't make me careless,
And my heart isn't desperate-
It's just ready.
Ready, but not willing
To settle for half-love
Or almost-effort.

I've seen some around me,
And with every glance I'm reminded
Why I've waited this long.
They're not you.
They don't feel like home,
And I won't pretend they do.

So I stay patient,
Content in the knowing
That love doesn't miss its target.
What's mine will find me-
In its own time,
In its own way,
In the exact moment my heart
Can finally exhale into yours.

Until then, dear,
I'm here-
Living, growing, becoming
The person you will recognize
The second our eyes meet

And when you come,
I'll be ready.

title: The Reminder
content:
You believed in me
At a time when I couldn't believe in myself.
You saw something hidden in me,
Something I had forgotten,
And you called it out gently.

You drew it out
Piece by piece,
And spoke life into it
Until it began to breathe again.
You never raised your voice,
Never rushed-
Yet your words found their way in,
Quiet but sharp,
Settling deep
Into the part of me
That needed them the most.

I felt defeated,
When pressure crept into my thoughts,
And you simply said,
'Don't fall for it.'
And somehow,
Those words lifted me-
Lifted my perspective,
Lifted my heart.

You showed me again how to stand
How to move forward,
How to become myself
Without losing myself.
And maybe
Reminding me who I truly was
Became the greatest gift
You ever gave me.

I hope one day
You understand
Just how deeply grateful I am-
Not just for what you did,
But for who you helped me remember
I could be.

title: He Crafted it All
content:
He picked up His pen -
It was the moment I was conceived.
In His mind,
I was in Him before I was.
Before I was formed in my mother's womb, He knew me.
I'm more ancient than you think;
I was His very idea!

Carefully, He wrote my story,
Wove it into an interesting plot.
What a creative author He was.
The story was immersive-
Like a woodcarver, He sculpted it
Into the most unique form ever,
It would never be similar to another person's.

When I came into the picture,
Started living out that story,
It wasn't easy at times.
So He gave me a manual
That I could keep referring to.
Sometimes it felt like I had reached the end,
Like I'd hit rock bottom.
But I'd look at the manual,
And it would speak for greater things-
Then I knew it wasn't over yet.

So I learned to trust the Author,
Because He had crafted it all.
He was definitely leading me somewhere,
And until I arrived at that destination,
I was going nowhere.
I was here to stay-
To walk with Him,
To journey with Him as we traveled there.

So with time I realized
It was a beautiful story
And more was yet to unfold!
